required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of a Polyphenol-enriched Protein Powder on Exercise-induced Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Athletes: a Metabolomics Approach

oversight_info.authority: USA: Appalachian State University Institutional Review Board

brief_summary.textblock: Nutrasorb is a newly developed food product (see www.nutrasorb.com). This study will use the Nutrasorb soy protein product that is matrixed with polyphenols from blueberries and green tea extract, and test for efficacy as a nutritional countermeasure to exercise-induced physiologic stress (i.e., immune dysfunction, inflammation, and oxidative stress) using both traditional and metabolomics-based outcome measures.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolomics; change in metabolites over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: 18-day period; Blood samples collected pre- and post-14 d supplementation, and immediately and 14 h after the third day of running

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 18-day period; Blood samples collected pre- and post-14 d supplementation, and immediately and 14 h after the third day of running
18-day period; Blood samples collected pre- and post-14 d supplementation, and immediately and 14 h after the third day of running
18-day period; Blood samples collected pre- and post-14 d supplementation, and immediately and 14 h after the third day of running
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-viral activity using virus-infected HeLa cells

arm_group.description: Soy protein powder sorbed with polyphenols from blueberries and green tea extract
Soy protein isolate powder without polyphenols (with food coloring)

intervention.description: from blueberry and green tea extracts (2,136 mg/d gallic acid equivalents)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female endurance athletes; competitive runners or cyclists
- Capable of exercising for 2.5 h at a high intensity in the lab
- Ages 18-55
- Agree to train normally and stay weight stable.
- Agree to avoid the use of large dose vitamin/mineral supplements
- Agree to avoid herbs and medications that influence inflammation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Regularly take supplements or medicines known to effect inflammation.
- At moderate or high risk for cardiovascular disease.
- Younger than 18 or older than 55 years of age.
- No history of competing in long distance running and cycling races.

facility.name: ASU Human Performance Laboratory, North Carolina Research Campus
